dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1709 IH: To amend title 1, United States Code, to provide for a definition of the term “State” and to include territories therein, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Plaskett introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 1, United States Code, to provide for a definition of the term State and to include territories therein, and for other purposes.

section.header: The term State To include territories for purposes of Federal law

subsection.header: The term State To include territories
subsection.text: Chapter 1 of title 1, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Rule of construction regarding the term State
section.text: In determining the meaning of any Act of Congress, or of any ruling, regulation, or interpretation of the various administrative bureaus and agencies of the United States, the term State shall include any territory of the United States, unless the statute, rule, regulation, or interpretation explicitly excludes the territories from the definition of the term or otherwise precludes their inclusion.

subsection.text: The table of sections for such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 9. Rule of construction regarding the term State.
